articles.author: Lucy Raitano, Danilo Masoni
articles.description: Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk briefly unseated LVMH (LVMH.PA) as Europe's most valuable listed company in intraday trading on Friday, ending the French luxury group's 2-1/2 year-long reign at the top.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk briefly overtakes LVMH as Europe's most valuable company

articles.author: Tom Sims, John O'Donnell
articles.description: It has been a tumultuous year for one prominent German property developer: his efforts to sell his penthouse atop a Nazi-era air raid shelter have stalled, and just weeks ago his firm filed for insolvency.
articles.title: From war bunker to penthouse to market flop: how Germany's property boom ended

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla has released what it called a refreshed version of its Model 3 vehicle in China with a starting price of 259,900 yuan ($35,807.78), the company's website showed on Friday.
articles.title: Tesla releases refreshed Model 3 with longer driving range in China - website

articles.author: Nivedita Balu
articles.description: After a sharp rise in mortgage repayment terms over the past few quarters, Canadian banks' home loans past 30 years have edged lower in the latest quarter but analysts say risks remain elevated with borrowing costs expected to stay higher for longer.
articles.title: Analysis: Canadian banks' see dip in 30 year-plus mortgages, but risks remain

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. job growth likely slowed in August, partly reflecting striking Hollywood actors and the bankruptcy of a major trucking company, but the unemployment rate probably held at more than 50-year lows as labor market conditions remain tight.
articles.title: Hollywood strike, Yellow bankruptcy likely restrained US job growth in August

articles.author: Noele Illien, Elisa Martinuzzi, John O'Donnell
articles.description: Switzerland was urged to prepare properly for the failure of a big bank on Friday by a group of experts in the wake of the collapse of Credit Suisse, but their report to government skirted radical reform some say is needed.
articles.title: In wake of Credit Suisse, Switzerland told to better prepare for bank failure

articles.author: Jonathan Cable, Leika Kihara
articles.description: A downturn in euro zone manufacturing eased last month, suggesting the worst may be over for the bloc's beleaguered factories, while an unexpected rebound in China offered some hope for export-reliant economies, private surveys showed.
articles.title: Euro zone manufacturing downturn eases, China rebound offers hope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three of China's biggest banks on Friday cut interest rates on a range of deposits in an effort to ease pressure on their shrinking margins as lenders move to lower mortgage rates to prop up a struggling property sector and a faltering economy.
articles.title: Major Chinese banks cut deposits rates, paving the way for mortgage rate cuts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's cyberspace regulator has received 110 applications from Chinese technology companies such as Huawei (HWT.UL) and Alibaba (9988.HK) for approvals related to models that can be used to manipulate visual and audio data.
articles.title: Huawei and Alibaba among companies seeking Chinese deepfake approvals

articles.author: Susanna Twidale, Sarah Mcfarlane
articles.description: Voluntary carbon markets have shrunk for the first time in at least seven years, as companies including food giant Nestle and fashion house Gucci reduced buying and studies found several forest protection projects did not deliver promised emissions savings.
articles.title: Carbon credit market confidence ebbs as big names retreat
